div1.opener:
COMPAÑIA SUNOCO DE CUBA, S.A.
AGENTES EXCLUSIVOS DE
SUN OIL COMPANY
SUN OILS
CABLE Y}

“SUNOCO”
CLAVE BENTLEY
TELEFONO U- 6148
SUNOCO
DESTILADO AL MERCURIO
AVENIDA MENOCAL NO. 102-A
HABANA.
July 24, 1937.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
First off, I want to apologize for delay in sending you the
attached “Story of Johnny Moran and the share he took in the yellow fever
experiments”. In the second place, I trust you can forgive me for the
imposition on your time and good nature which perusal of the “story” in-
volves. Lastly, please overlook the number of misspelt words and other
errors. It was all written by myself and in the order in which “the spirit
moved me”, hence it is far from perfect, either in composition or otherwise.
I believe you will be able to prepare an acceptable short talk on the subject
as a whole for the staff at Mayo Clinic. In the script you will find refer-
ence to books on the yellow fever experiments and Walter Reed. It is barely
possible that your Library may have “The Popular Science Monthly” which became
“The Scientific Monthly”, Volume 1, October to December, 1915. In the December,
1915, issue you will find an article entitled “The Inside History of a Great
Medical Discovery” by Aristides Agramonte, M. D., Sc. D. (Hon), University of
Havana. Dr. Agramonte was the Cuban member of the Yellow Fever Board. I am
sure you will find his article of great assistance in preparing your proposed
paper for reading before the staff of Mayo Clinic.

In my brief talk on the radio - it was really more of a quiz on the
part of Lowell Thomas than a talk by me - the points which appealed most to
him, and which he stressed, related to my five-dollar bet with Jernegan and to
Major Reed's joy on finding I had yellow fever. His introductory remarks
were A SYNOPSIS of Walter Reed's findings and their farreaching effects both
in Latin America and in our own United States, yellow fever epidemics having
raised havoc more than once in Philadelphia, New Orleans, Memphis, Galveston
and other cities of the South, always taking a heavy toll in human lives.

If I can send you any additional data, please do not hesitate to
call upon me. Seeing that you are interested in the matter, it will be a
pleasure to me to serve you.
